instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera light flashing/not working.
threads.message: Good morning, I am trying to repair this mac, I have already replaced the <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, but no solution so far. Do you have any idea what it could be ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera light flashing/not working.
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did you try known good screen assembly first?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera light flashing/not working.
threads.message:
Yes, I tested more than one display that works the camera.
    There was oxidation on the L4007,L4009.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera light flashing/not working.
